search_results.title: Paris facts: the capital of France in history

Paris | Definition, Map, Population, Facts, & History - Britannica
Paris, France - Intercultural City - The Council of Europe

message.content:
The **capital of France is Paris**. It is the largest city in the country and serves as the political, cultural, and economic center of France[1][2][3][4][5].

Key details about Paris as the capital of France:

- Paris has been the capital since 1944, after its liberation during World War II, with some interruptions in history such as during the German occupation when Vichy was the capital[1][3].
- It is located along the Seine River in the north-central part of France, within the Île-de-France region[4][5].
- The city covers an area of about 105 km² (41 sq mi) and has a population of approximately 2 million people as of 2025, with the metropolitan area housing over 10 million residents[2][4][5].
- Paris is a global center for finance, diplomacy, commerce, culture, fashion, and gastronomy, often called the "City of Light" due to its historical role in arts and sciences[2].

Thus, Paris is the historic and current capital of France, central to the nation's identity and functioning.
